required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Study Comparing Endostaplers in Sleeve Gastrectomy

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this prospective, post-market study is to measure AEON™ Endostapler performance for laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy surgery versus the Endo GIA™ Reloads with Tri-Staple™ Technology from Medtronic.

detailed_description.textblock: Stapler performance will be evaluated primarily by incidence and degree of staple line bleeding from endoscopic images, evaluated by a blinded third-party. The study will include 60 total consecutive cases of individuals undergoing a planned laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy (LSG). The LSG procedure will be performed according to institutional standard-of-care and all subjects will undergo standard preoperative evaluation as well as post-operative care.

primary_outcome.measure: Intraoperative Endoscopic Staple Line Bleeding Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within surgery, after the last stapler firing
primary_outcome.description: Intraoperative staple line bleeding score from endoscopic images as measured by the provided Bleeding Severity Scale (1 = No bleeding; 2 = Minimal bleeding; 3= Moderate bleeding; 4 = Excessive bleeding; 5 = Profuse bleeding). A lower value represents a better outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Intraoperative Laparoscopic Staple Line Bleeding Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within surgery, images captured 10 seconds after the last stapler firing
primary_outcome.description: Intraoperative staple line bleeding score from laparoscopic images as measured by the provided Bleeding Severity Scale (1 = No bleeding; 2 = Minimal bleeding; 3= Moderate bleeding; 4 = Excessive bleeding; 5 = Profuse bleeding). A lower value represents a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Postoperative Leakage Requiring Intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with postoperative leakage requiring intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Intraoperative or Postoperative Blood Transfusion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 72 hours of surgery start time
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with intraoperative or postoperative blood transfusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Reported Device-related Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with reported device-related adverse events

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Product Malfunction
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with product malfunction. Product malfunction means any occurrence during the surgery where the stapler does not perform as intended.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Endo GIA Reloads with Tri-Staple Technology
arm_group.description: Stapling performed with Endo GIA Reloads with Tri-Staple Technology

intervention.intervention_name: Endo GIA Reloads with Tri-Staple Technology
intervention.description: Surgery with Endo GIA Reloads with Tri-Staple Technology
intervention.arm_group_label: Endo GIA Reloads with Tri-Staple Technology

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing planned laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy
- Informed consent for study obtained and signed from each subject
Exclusion Criteria:
- Planned open surgical approach
- Use of staple line reinforcement material (buttress)
- Revision or other bariatric procedure
- Patients with a bleeding disorder: known coagulopathy, or Platelets <100,000, or Partial Thromboplastin Time (PTT) >45sec, or Prothrombin Time (PT) >15sec, or International Normalized Ratio (INR) >1.5
- Patients with active HIV or Hepatitis B
- Patients under the age of 18 on the date of the surgery
- Patients who are pregnant
- Patients using tobacco products within the last 2 weeks prior to surgery date
- Patients using cortisone or related products within the last 2 weeks prior to surgery date

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
